intro: Lactuca cavaleriei, commonly known as the Cavalerie's lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the dandelion family, Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and form a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. The plant is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
